column5: **I posted this same topic in 'Fishing News" by mistake. Is it possible that an admin could delete the original post?** Hi All, Me and a few buddies want to get away for a weekend fishing. Can anyone suggest a few options for campsites (tenting) that offer ok bass fishing on a lake, within about 2 hours or so of Toronto? We have a 14 foot boat with motor and will need to launch it. Thanks for any help!
I used to catch a lot of Bass at 6 mile lake PP....30 years ago when I went there regularly
I would second that suggestion! Bass Lake Provincial Park is a nice little park and the bass fishing is pretty good!
Another great choice, Balsam Lake Provincial Park is also a good option! Lots of choices!
Emily. Pigeon has really good largemouth down in the south end. Dece smallies up north too. A bit further but Sturgeon Bay has really good smallmouth fishing.

Ontario without a doubt has the best bass fishing anywhere in the world. Personally I would pick lakes where I can avoid crowds or if Im only running a 14 foot tinner where I can avoid getting swamped. Aside from that you can basically pick your poison.
Thanks everyone. Good advice! I'm going to look up the places you suggested.
For Bass I would second Emily PP..
I agree, you can start fishing right at the ramp
Beausoleil Island CG Launch out of Honey Harbor. https://www.pc.gc.ca/en/pn-np/on/georg/activ/camping
Used to go there all the time back in the day. Would load up my 12 foot tinny with 5 1/2 hp Johnson and make the trip.

I know many have mentioned Emily Park, but the lake is getting a super amount of pressure this year and the fishing is suffering from my experience. Pick a nice small lake in Haliburton County around West Guilford, you will enjoy the lower amount of boat traffic and no deer flies.
